text.text: The Apple ][ is one of the world's first highly successful mass-produced microcomputer products. It was designed by Steve Wozniak and marketed on June 10, 1977. The original Apple ][ uses an 8-bit CPU with 4KB of RAM. Accessories include a floppy drive, a cassette player and paddle controllers. It could display up to a resolution of 280x192 in 6 colors (Apple redesigned their logo to showcase this) via composite video. Later models would up the highest resolution mode to 560x192 in monochrome. The Apple ][ line was discontinued in 1993.
